meanings.definition: A show of boldness or confidence intended to impress or intimidate.
meanings.sent1: His bravados in front of the mirror were meant to impress his friends.
meanings.sent2: The villain's bravados only made him seem more insecure.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor's bravados made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her bravados were like a shield, hiding her true feelings from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's bravados before battle inspired his comrades to stand tall.
